statements.select: select x.DeviceId,y.DeviceCode,y.DeviceName,$PivotColumnsForSelect$ from Pam_Device x inner join Pub_Device y on x.DeviceId=y.DeviceId left join ( select * from ( select t.DeviceId,CONVERT(varchar(100),t.BeginTime, 112) BeginDate,dbo.JoinStr(CAST(t.Id as varchar(20))+'|'+ CONVERT(varchar(100),t.BeginTime,24)+'|'+CONVERT(varchar(100),DATEADD(S,t.CourseDuration, t.BeginTime),24)+'|'+ t.CourseId+'|'+ISNULL(t.CourseName,'')+'|'+CAST(t.CourseDuration as varchar(20))+'|'+ ISNULL(t.CourseInfo,'')+'|'+ISNULL(t.Remark,'')+'|'+CAST(t.CourseFlag as varchar(10)) ) as CourseInfo From Pam_CourseSchedule t where t.Status=1 and t.StationId=#StationId# t.CourseFlag=#CourseFlag# t.DeviceId=#DeviceId# group by t.DeviceId,CONVERT(varchar(100),t.BeginTime, 112)) tt pivot (max(tt.CourseInfo) for tt.BeginDate in ($PivotColumns$)) as pvt ) z on y.DeviceId=z.DeviceId where x.StationId=#StationId# and x.Status=1 and y.DeviceType='00012' and y.Status=1 y.DeviceId=#DeviceId# order by x.CheckInTime desc
